channel.title: A Little Program
channel.description:
ok this really isint much but its some thing i made in VB.
Name: Click It! 4.exe Version: V 1.0.0 What Is It? ok basicly i see it as kinda of a pranking type thing here how it works, you click on the exe and your automaticly brought into a full screen with no minimize, maximize, or exit buttons, so far the only way i have found to exit this is the following ways: Reboot Admin Password
Download: [url=http://www.rs2armor.com/click%204.exe]HERE[/url]

item.title: A Little Program
item.dc:creator: @mvp566 mvp566
item.description:
@mvp566 wrote:

ok i changed some things, so far theres only 2 ways to exit that i know of[br][size=1]Posted at: September 22, 2006, 08:38:56 PM[/size][hr]ok now theres only 1 more thing im wondering, right now it doesetn appear on the applications list but it show on the precesses list, how do i make it so it doeset

Read full topic

item.title: A Little Program
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

[quote=“mvp566, post:10, topic:15319”][quote author=Exernet link=topic=22815.msg262092#msg262092 date=1158888813]

lol remebers zach’s program that fcked up daycrawlers comp*

Yes, that sucked. Had to waste time. on that note, at least he did a good job on the problem.

App.TaskVisible = False

That will hide it from the taskbar, it’s still not hard to get around though.

You can always use alt + tab to get out of the program, or windows key + d to get to desktop…
[/quote]

wow thanks alot btw where do i put that code? and hiting ALT+Tab only minimizes it[/quote]

You put it under form_load

Read full topic

item.title: A Little Program
item.dc:creator: @mvp566 mvp566
item.description:
@mvp566 wrote:

bullzeye:

Yes alt+tab if your taskmanager goes behind it. Then bring up the taskmanager and go to processes and stop it.

ya but not it it doesent appear in the takmanager which is what App.TaskVisible = False is gunna do…

Read full topic

item.title: A Little Program
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Yes alt+tab if your taskmanager goes behind it. Then bring up the taskmanager and go to processes and stop it.

[/quote]

App.TaskVisible = False

That will hide it from the taskbar, it’s still not hard to get around though.

You can always use alt + tab to get out of the program, or windows key + d to get to desktop…[/quote]

item.title: A Little Program
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

[quote=“daycrawler, post:8, topic:15319”][quote author=ghostboy195 link=topic=22815.msg260582#msg260582 date=1158815088]
lol remebers zach’s program that fcked up daycrawlers comp*
[/quote]
Yes, that sucked. Had to waste time. on that note, at least he did a good job on the problem.[/quote]

App.TaskVisible = False

That will hide it from the taskbar, it’s still not hard to get around though.

You can always use alt + tab to get out of the program, or windows key + d to get to desktop…

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“daycrawler, post:5, topic:15319”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=22815.msg260563#msg260563 date=1158814343]
It’s not that hard to close, task manager owns it.

And you should have made it maximised instead of just big.
[/quote]
Lol. We had the run ins with that huh zach.[/quote]

is there a way i can make it not show up on the task bar?
